contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox musical artist | name = Jacob's Mouse | image = | caption = | image_size = <!-- Only for images narrower than 220 pixels --> | background = group_or_band | origin = [[Bury St. Edmunds]], [[Suffolk]], [[United Kingdom|UK]] | genre = [[Indie rock]] | years_active = 1991–1995 | label = Blithering Idiot<br/>[[Wiiija]] | associated_acts = Machismo's<br>Volunteers | current_members = <!-- not currently active --> | past_members = Hugo Boothby<br/>Jebb Boothby<br/>Sam Marsh }} '''Jacob's Mouse''' was a three-piece [[indie rock]] band from [[Bury St Edmunds]], [[Suffolk]], England. They comprised [[identical twin]]s Hugo and Jebb Boothby) on [[guitar]] and [[guitar|bass]] respectively, along with singing drummer Sam Marsh. Despite some critical acclaim, and a successful UK tour supporting [[Babes in Toyland (band)|Babes in Toyland]] and [[Trumans Water]], they failed to achieve [[mainstream popularity]]. Following the release of their ''Rubber Room'' LP in 1995, Jacob's Mouse split. Marsh went on to record a couple of singles and two unreleased albums as The Machismo's. Sam Marsh played in oldschool hardcore band 'Volunteers' for a time, before forming dub band 'Zen Reggae Masters'. ==Discography== ===Singles/EPs=== *''The Dot EP'' *''Ton Up EP'' *''Play,s World Dom (Two 'World Domination Enterprises' covers) *''Ablaze!'' - [[flexidisc]] with [[Cornershop]], [[Trumans Water]] and [[Bivouac (band)|Bivouac]] *''Good'' *''Group Of Seven'' *''Fandango Widewheels'' *''Hawaiian Vice'' ===Albums=== * ''No Fish Shop Parking'' (Blithering Idiot, 1991) * ''I'm Scared'' ([[Wiiija]], 1993) - cover photo by [[Joe Dilworth]] * ''Wryly Smilers'' (EP/singles compilation on Wiiija, 1994) * ''Rubber Room'' ([[Wiiija]], 1995) ==External links== * [http://www.myspace.com/jacobsmouse Jacob's Mouse on MySpace] * [http://www.volunteers.tk Volunteers website] {{DEFAULTSORT:Jacobs Mouse}} [[Category:British post-grunge groups]]
